title: Takuya Mikami
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. His older brother <a href="Kazuyoshi%20Mikami">Kazuyoshi</a> is also a former football player.
Playing career.
Mikami was born in <a href="Saitama%20%28city%29">Saitama</a> on February 13, 1980. After graduating from <a href="Komazawa%20University">Komazawa University</a>, he joined his local club <a href="Urawa%20Reds">Urawa Reds</a> in <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> in 2002. Although he played several matches as left side midfielder, he hardly played in matches until 2004. In June 2004, he moved to <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> club <a href="Kyoto%20Sanga%20FC">Kyoto Purple Sanga</a> (later "Kyoto Sanga FC"). He soon became a regular player as left side back. Sanga won the champions in <a href="2005%20J.League%20Division%202">2005 season</a> and was promoted to J1. However his opportunity to play decreased from 2006 and Sanga was relegated to J2 a year later. In 2008, he moved to J2 club <a href="Ehime%20FC">Ehime FC</a>. He played as regular left side back. However his opportunity to play decreased from 2010 and he retired at the end of the 2011 season.
